evaluation.Q1: Does the chart effectively compare the average N, P, K values across different crops?

feedback.improvement: The grouped bar chart effectively shows N, P, K values for multiple crops
Consider reordering crops alphabetically or by nutrient values for easier comparison

evaluation.Q2: Are the 'rice' values clearly highlighted with distinct colors?

feedback.improvement: Highlight 'rice' bars with a distinct color to make them stand out

evaluation.Q3: Does the chart include text annotations for 'rice' and 'wheat' displaying their average N, P, K values?

feedback.improvement: Include text annotations for 'rice' and 'wheat' showing their N, P, K values

evaluation.Q4: Is the chart type a bar chart as specified in the user instruction?

feedback.improvement: The grouped bar chart format effectively displays the data as requested

evaluation.Q5: Are the axis labels clear and informative, allowing for easy interpretation of the data?

feedback.improvement: The x-axis label 'Crop' and y-axis label 'Average Value' are clear and informative
Consider adding units to the y-axis label for more clarity (e.g., 'Average Value (kg/ha)')

evaluation.Q6: Is there a clear visual hierarchy that guides attention to key information, particularly for rice and wheat?

feedback.improvement: Highlight rice and wheat bars with distinct colors to create visual hierarchy
Consider adding text annotations or markers to draw attention to rice and wheat

evaluation.Q7: Does the chart have a clear, concise title that accurately describes its content?

feedback.improvement: The title 'Average Nutrient Values per Crop' accurately describes the chart content

evaluation.Q8: Is the color scheme used in the chart easily distinguishable and appropriate for the target audience?

feedback.improvement: The grayscale color scheme is easily distinguishable
Consider using color to highlight key crops (rice and wheat) for better emphasis

evaluation.Q9: Are the font choices and sizes appropriate and legible for all text elements in the chart?

feedback.improvement: The font choices and sizes are appropriate and legible for all text elements
Consider increasing the font size of the x-axis labels for better readability

evaluation.Q10: Does the chart avoid unnecessary decorative elements that might distract from the data?

feedback.improvement: The chart design is clean and free from unnecessary decorative elements

evaluation.Q11: Is the overall presentation of the chart simple and clear enough for agricultural researchers, farmers, and policymakers to understand?

feedback.improvement: The chart presents data in a simple and clear manner suitable for the target audience
Consider adding a brief explanation or context to help interpret the nutrient values

evaluation.Q12: Does the chart allow for easy identification of trends or patterns in nutrient requirements among crops?

feedback.improvement: The grouped bar chart allows for comparison of nutrient requirements across crops
Consider sorting crops by a specific nutrient value to make trends more apparent

evaluation.Q13: Is the contrast between text and background colors sufficient for good readability?

feedback.improvement: The black text on white background provides good contrast for readability

evaluation.Q14: If present, do grid lines effectively aid in value comparisons without cluttering the chart?

feedback.improvement: The light gray grid lines aid in value comparisons without cluttering the chart

evaluation.Q15: Does the chart balance highlighting rice and wheat while maintaining visibility of other crops?

feedback.improvement: Highlight rice and wheat bars with distinct colors to balance emphasis
Add text annotations for rice and wheat to draw attention while maintaining visibility of other crops
